character.name: Mahatma Gandhi
character.description: Leader of the Indian independence movement and advocate of nonviolent resistance

meta.notes: Mahatma Gandhi, often referred to as the 'Father of the Nation' in India, led India to independence from British rule through nonviolent civil disobedience. His philosophy of Satyagraha (truth-force) and Ahimsa (nonviolence) inspired movements for civil rights and freedom across the world. Gandhi's principles of peace, tolerance, and equality remain relevant today.
